t: The Lord a Refuge and Defense.
For the choir director. A Psalm of David.
In*pn the Lord*s I take refuge; How*ln can you say to my soul, “Flee as*i a bird to your mountain;
For,*ln behold, the wicked bend the bow, They*ln make ready their arrow upon the string To*ln shoot in darkness at the upright in heart.
If*ln the foundations are destroyed, What*ln can the righteous do?”
The*ln Lord*s is in His holy temple; the Lord’s*s throne is in heaven; His*ln eyes behold, His eyelids test the sons of men.
The*ln Lord*s tests the righteous and the wicked, And*ln the one who loves violence His soul hates.
Upon*ln the wicked He will rain snares; Fire*ln and brimstone and burning wind will be the portion of their cup.
For*ln the Lord*s is righteous, He loves righteousness; The*ln upright will behold His face.
